Module Generic SNMPv3

Available versions


  • ver. 5.0
  • ver. 6.0
  • ver. 5.4


Back to index Download

Module Generic SNMPv3

Description

Template Module Generic SNMPv3 Template used Template Module Generic SNMPv2 Ville Leinonen https://www.hacknetwork.org Version 1.1

Overview

UPDATED: There was a bug in version 1.0

Linked for Template Net HP and Aruba Enterprise Switch SNMPv3, but works also individually.

SNMPv3 support added, new macros:

{$SECURITY_NAME} = Username

{$AUTH_PASSPHRASE} = Authentication password

{$PRIV_PASSPHRASE} = Encryption password

Template is just like V2 templates, but changed to support SNMPv3, please use SHA and AES128.

Macros used

Name Description Default Type
{$SNMP.TIMEOUT} <p>-</p> 5m Text macro

Template links

Name
Template Module ICMP Ping

Discovery rules

There are no discovery rules in this template.

Items collected

|Name|Description|Type|Key and additional info| |—-|———–|—-|—-| |SNMP agent availability|<p>-</p>|Zabbix internal|zabbix[host,snmp,available]<p>Update: 1m</p>| |System object ID|<p>MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The vendor’s authoritative identification of the network management subsystem contained in the entity. This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determiningwhat kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendorFlintstones, Inc.’ was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its Fred Router'.</p>|SNMP agent|system.objectidV3[sysObjectID.0]<p>Update: 15m</p>| |System description|<p>MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.</p>|SNMP agent|system.descrV3[sysDescr.0]<p>Update: 1h</p>| |SNMP traps (fallback)|<p>Item is used to collect all SNMP traps unmatched by other snmptrap items</p>|SNMP trap|snmptrap.fallback<p>Update: 0</p>| |System contact details|<p>MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.</p>|SNMP agent|system.contactV3[sysContact.0]<p>Update: 1h</p>| |System location|<p>MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., telephone closet, 3rd floor’). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.</p>|SNMP agent|system.locationV3[sysLocation.0]<p>Update: 1h</p>| |Uptime|<p>MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.</p>|SNMP agent|system.uptimeV3[sysUpTime.0]<p>Update: 30s</p>| |System name|<p>MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node’s fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.</p>|SNMP agent|system.nameV3<p>Update: 1h</p>|

Triggers

There are no triggers in this template.

Module Generic SNMPv3

Description

Template Module Generic SNMPv3 Template used Template Module Generic SNMPv2 Ville Leinonen https://www.hacknetwork.org Version 1.1

Overview

UPDATED: There was a bug in version 1.0

Linked for Template Net HP and Aruba Enterprise Switch SNMPv3, but works also individually.

SNMPv3 support added, new macros:

{$SECURITY_NAME} = Username

{$AUTH_PASSPHRASE} = Authentication password

{$PRIV_PASSPHRASE} = Encryption password

Template is just like V2 templates, but changed to support SNMPv3, please use SHA and AES128.

Macros used

Name Description Default Type
{$SNMP.TIMEOUT} <p>-</p> 5m Text macro

Template links

Name
Template Module ICMP Ping

Discovery rules

There are no discovery rules in this template.

This value is allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides an easy and unambiguous means for determiningwhat kind of box' is being managed. For example, if vendorFlintstones, Inc.’ was assigned the subtree1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, it could assign the identifier 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.1 to its Fred Router'.</p>|SNMP agent|system.objectidV3[sysObjectID.0]<p>Update: 15m</p>| |SNMP agent availability|<p>-</p>|Zabbix internal|zabbix[host,snmp,available]<p>Update: 1m</p>| |Uptime|<p>MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The time (in hundredths of a second) since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.</p>|SNMP agent|system.uptimeV3[sysUpTime.0]<p>Update: 30s</p>| |System description|<p>MIB: SNMPv2-MIB A textual description of the entity. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.</p>|SNMP agent|system.contactV3[sysContact.0]<p>Update: 1h</p>| |System name|<p>MIB: SNMPv2-MIB An administratively-assigned name for this managed node.By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.</p>|SNMP agent|system.nameV3<p>Update: 1h</p>| |System location|<p>MIB: SNMPv2-MIB The physical location of this node (e.g., telephone closet, 3rd floor’). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.</p>|SNMP agent|system.locationV3[sysLocation.0]<p>Update: 1h</p>|

Triggers

There are no triggers in this template.

Description

Template Module Generic SNMPv3 Template used Template Module Generic SNMPv2 Ville Leinonen https://www.hacknetwork.org Version 1.1

Overview

Template is just like V2 templates, but changed to support SNMPv3, please use SHA and AES128.
